newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-DIRECTIONLESS MARKET LANGUISHES IN FRIDAY TRADE.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-DIRECTIONLESS MARKET LANGUISHES IN FRIDAY TRADE.

text.p: The Estonian bourse continued to
languish on Friday with stock prices gaining only very slightly
or sliding lower, dealer said
Total trade on the main list was 25.9 million kroons with
the Talse 0.07 percent lower at 252.15.
"There is no real support to push the stocks higher or to
stop them drifting lower, one dealer said.
"There is no clear indication when the drifting will end,
we may have to wait until late summer or autumn," he added.
Hoiupank was the most active with 11.1 million kroons
changing hands for a small gain of 0.03 kroons to close at
133.09 kroons.
"Hoiupank is still strongly traded, but there are no real
gains, perhaps investors might pick another banking stock to
follow next week," another dealer said.
Hansapank firmed slightly to close at 129.86 kroons, up
0.36 kroons after turning over 7.5 million kroons.
The free market was quiet with diversified industrialist
Nomra the most active.
Norma saw trade of 1.7 million kroons to be 0.10 kroons
higher at 68.80 kroons.
-- David Mardiste, Tallinn newsroom, +372 630 8400
reuters@reuters.ee
